Technique Chains (Version 3)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Techs/Tech Chains: Technique Chains (Version 3)
By The Man on Wednesday, September 27, 2000 - 02:21 pm:

Ape:
Bomb -> Big Bomb
Grab-Throw -> Swing Throw

Arrowhead:
Sting -> Triple Stings
Energy Shot -> Energy Shots
Somersault -> Somersaults

Bajarl:
Right Jab -> Straight
Right Jab -> 1-2 Smash (good)
Straight -> Magic Punch -> Mystic Punch (Good) -> Mystic Combo (Good)
Straight -> Hook -> 1-2-Hook
Uppercut -> 1-2-Uppercut
Magic Pot (Evil) -> Mystic Pot (Evil) -> Miracle Pot (Evil)

Baku:
Bite -> Two Bites -> Three Bites
Roar -> Two Roars -> Million Roars

Beaclon:
Punch -> Heavy Punch -> Maximal Punch
Horn Strike -> Horn Attack
Horn Cannon -> Frantic Horn
Tremor -> Earthquake
Dive Assault -> Spiral Dive
Punch Combo -> Beaclon Combo

Centaur:
Smash -> Smash Combo
Energy Shot -> Energy Shots
Mind Flare -> Mind Blast
Cross Slash -> Z Slash
Javelin ->Jumping Javelin

Color Pandora:
Tail Swing -> Two Swings
Giant Whip -> Giant Wheel
Shotgun -> Megashotgun
Cracker -> Megacracker

Dragon:
Bite -> Two Bites
Tail Whip -> Tail Attack
Wing Attack -> Wing Combo
Fire breath -> Inferno
Flutter -> Flutters
Claw Combo -> Flying Combo
Claw -> Spinning Claw

Ducken:
Eye Beam -> Beam Shower-> Maximal Beam(good)
Missle -> Two Missles(good)
Missle -> Big Missle(evil)
Bound -> Bound Charge -> Bound Stamp

Durahan:
Rush Slash -> Dash Slash
Lightning(evil) -> Thunderbolt(evil)
Air Shot(good) -> Blast Shot(good)
Cut-in-Two -> Swing

Gaboo:
Spit(Evil) -> Acid Spit(Evil)
Chop -> Rolling Chop
Samurai Kick -> Ninja Kick(evil)
Back Blow -> Electric Blow

Gali:
Whirlwind -> Typhoon -> Hurricane
Fire Wall -> Blaze Wall -> Napalm
Thwack -> Smash Thwack -> Giant Thwack
Flying Mask -> Cutting Mask -> Hashing Mask
Back Blow -> Heavy Blow -> Giant Blow
Spirit Blow -> Spirit Punch (good)
Spirit Blow -> Spirit Smash (evil)

Ghost:
Magic card -> Magic cards
Energy shot -> Necromancy
Dove Bomb -> Pigeon bomb
Surprise -> Astonishment
Uppercut -> Combination

Golem:
Punch -> Heavy Punch
Kick -> Heavy Kick
Brow Hit -> Brow Smash
Slap -> Heavy Slap
Palm Strike -> Double Palms
Thwack(evil) + Punch -> Smash Thwack(evil)
(You must use Thwack 50 times and Punch 30 times and your monster must be bad natured)

Hare:
Gas -> Stinking Gas(evil)
Back Blow -> Smash -> Hard Smash
Back Blow -> Rolling Blow
Straight -> Hard Straight
Bang -> Big Bang
Kung Fu Fist -> Spin Kick ->Kung Fu Kick
High Kick -> Spin Kick -> Kung Fu Kick
(This one has not been proven yet. It is not sure which order the chain goes. It seems that you need to use High Kick to get Spin Kick. And it seems that you need to use Kung Fu Fist 50x along with Spin Kick 50x to get Kung Fu Kick)

Henger:
Punch -> Heavy Chop
Punch -> Eye Beam
(To get one of the chains you use Punch 30x to get the other one you use Punch 50x)
Low Kick -> Kick
Fist Missile ->Drill Shot -> Drill Shots
Hammer Fall -> Sledge Fall
Arm Cannon -> Napalm Shot -> Burst Cannon
Laser Cutter -> Two Cutters
Yoyo -> Two Yoyos
Laser Sword -> Laser Swords

Hopper:
Jump Blow -> 2 Jump Blows -> 3 Jump Blows(good)
1-2 Jump Blow -> Hopper Combo
Flick -> Rapid Flick -> Flick Combo(evil)

Jell:
Stab -> Pierce
Whip -> Two Whips
Jell Top -> Spiked Top
Fly Swatter -> Fly Smasher
Jell Cube -> Three Cubes
Beam Gun -> Beam Cannon

Jill:
Punch Combo -> Jill Combo
Double Slaps -> Slap Combo(evil)

Joker: No CHAINS

Kato:
Twister Claw -> Tornado Claw
Hopping Claw -> Jumping Claw -> Heavy Claw
Turn Claw -> Turn Claws -> Rolling Claw
Slash Claw -> Slash Claws -> Claw Combo

Metalner:
High Kick -> Double Kicks
Straight -> Dash Straight
Double Palms -> Burning Palms(good)

Mew:
Miaow -> Song Of Mew -> Recital
Zap -> Maximal Zap
Hundred Blows -> Million Blows
Twiddling -> Twiddling-2 -> Twiddling-Z
Head Butt(good) -> Head Assault(good)

Mocchi:
Thrust -> 1-2 Thrust -> Thrusts
Press -> Diving Press -> Giant Press
Roll Attack -> Dazzling Roll
Roll Assault -> Petal Roll
Mocchi Ray -> Mocchi Beam -> Mocchi Cannon
Petal Swirl -> Petal Storm(Evil) -> Petal Vortex(good)

Mock:
Twister -> Twisters
Leaf Gun -> Leaf Gatling

Monol:
Flattening -> Flattening-L -> Flattening-X
Beam -> Double Beams -> Triple Beams(good)
Ray -> Double Rays -> Triple Rays
Knock -> Two Knocks -> Three Knocks
Needle Stabs -> Spike Stabs -> Spike Bite

Naga:
Energy Shot -> Energy Shots
Tail Assault -> Turn Assault

Niton:
Shock -> Severe Shock -> Maximal Shock
Sound Wave -> Sound Wave-L -> Sound Wave-X
Stab -> Numbing Stab -> Electric Stab
Numbing Whip -> Electric Whip -> Million Whips(good)
Shell Attack -> Spiked Shell -> Violent Shell

Phoenix:
Fire Twister -> Fire Tornado(Good)
Flame Shot -> Flame Cannon(Evil)
Fire Stream -> Fire Wave

Pixie:
Pat -> Slap
Kick -> High Kick -> Heel Raid
Ray -> Megaray -> Gigaray
Flame -> Gigaflame
Bang -> Big Bang
Bolt -> Lightning

Plant:
Seed Gun -> Seed Gatling(good)
Toxic Nectar -> Toxic Pollen
Jab -> Jab Combo -> Plant Combo
Root Attack -> Root Combo

Suezo: NO CHAINS

Tiger: NO CHAINS

Undine:
Ice Sword -> Ice Swords
Aqua Whip(evil) -> Two Whips(evil)
Arrow -> Ice Arrow -> Icicle Arrow
Aqua Wave -> Aqua Waves
Cold Whirl -> Cold Storm
Water Gun -> Water Cannon

Worm:
Tail Lash -> Two Lashes -> Three Lashes
Somersault -> Somersaults

Wracky:
Weapon -> Weapon Combo
Air Shot -> Blast Shot
Kick -> Spin Kick -> Twister Kick
Punch -> Heavy Punch
Beat Dance -> Cursed Dance
Head Spike -> Fire Spike
Flame -> Fire Juggler
Necromancy -> Trick

Zilla:
Charge -> Zilla Rush
Sneeze -> Bubbles(evil)
Body Press -> Wave Riding
You'll get either Tidal Wave or Body Press
randomly the first time you do the Special Errantry,
so reset if you don't get the one you want. But, it seems that to get Wave Riding you have to accept Tidal Wave(good) first.

Zuum:
Charge(good) -> Firecharge(good)
Bite -> Million Bites -> Bite-Throw
Claw -> Million Claws -> Claw Combo
Tail -> Tail Combo Tail -> Tail Lash Tail -> Tail Lashes
(Use Tail 30x to open Tail Lash,Tail Lashes & Tail Combo)
Bite -> Bite-Throw -> Million Bites
Fire Ball -> Jumping Fire -> Fire Breath
Five Balls -> Fire Bomb
Jumping Claw -> Diving Claw -> Aerial Claw
Roll Assault -> Burning Roll

And thats about what I've found.I haven't tested all of these, but I've had help from nurmerous people. I thank everybody that helped.

Note: "Sneak Attack -> Sneak Combo" removed by Lisa Shock on 01/06/2010. I kept getting Sneak Combo first, then I reset a lot and got Sneak Attack after at least 30 tries. My Wracky was 5months old, from CD and had never battled. These are not chained.

By Petit-Trot on Thursday, September 28, 2000 - 09:54 am:

Ok, here's something. I'm now raising a Wracky. I went on the int errantry to get necromancy. In your list, Trick is chained with Necromancy. Right after the errantry (I gave up the battle immediatly, did no move) I rested and then went on the same errantry. The guy there said I could get a new tech, and I actually got Trick.

I was under the impression that I had to use necromancy a number of times before being able to get Tricks.

Does this mean that there are some chained techs that require only to have the first one, without actually using it, to get the second?

Or are Necromancy and Trick not really chained? But I think it makes sense that they would be chained. They're the same, except that Trick has more withering.

By The Man on Thursday, September 28, 2000 - 11:02 am:

Thats one of the thing with the chains, some of the moves only require you to get the other move. Some don't require you to actually use the move. I don't have a full list of those but I know there are some.

The reason this is is because of the way the techniques are. In order to get the one, you have to get the other one. It's because of the way the are locked. So technically they aren't chains, but I count them as it anyway.
